snippet: Mohamed Morsi, Egypt’s president, upended the country’s security apparatus after the deadliest attack on the Egyptian military in years.
abstract: President Mohamed Morsi of Egypt fires his intelligence chief and other top security officials in a sweeping response by his new government to the killings of 16 soldiers in the Sinai Peninsula; announces that he will replace the head of the military police, several Interior Ministry officials and the head of the presidential guard.

byline.contributor: Mayy El Sheikh contributed reporting from El Arish, and Alan Cowell from London.

lead_paragraph: Mohamed Morsi, Egypt’s president, upended the country’s security apparatus after the deadliest attack on the Egyptian military in years.

headline.seo: Morsi Fires Intelligence Chief and Sinai Governor Over Soldiers’ Killings
headline.main: Egyptian Officials Fired Over Soldiers’ Killings in Sinai
headline.print_headline: Egypt Leader Fires Spy Chief and Governor Over Soldier Deaths
